body.p: The purpose of a fragment is to define a (X)HTML fragment that may be reused. A fragment is placed on a module by the PI: . The definition-element may contain any number of fragment-elements.

tr.td: Any string that will identify this fragment.
A string. May be accessed in fragment PI instead of content. Content defaults to short and short defaults to id.

body.p: The content of a fragment element may be a simple text or any legal XML-fragment wrapped as CDATA.

Note that fragment may be used as author identification, see . A special predefined author id, _defaultauthor, comes in handy. It defaults to Site author, and you may change it as shown below. All modules are supposed to have this author if not told otherwise.
